1.text: Paul and Timothy, bondservants of Jesus Christ; To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons:

2.text: Grace to you and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.text: I give thanks to my God whenever I remember you,

4.text: and I always pray with joy when I intercede on your behalf

5.text: because of your partnership in the furtherance of the Good News, even from the very first day until now.

6.text: I am confident of this very thing: that God who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ.

7.text: It is right for me to think this way about you, because I have you in my heart and because you are all partakers with me of grace, both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the Good News.

8.text: For God is my witness: I long for all of you in the tender mercies of Jesus Christ!

9.text: I pray [especially] for this, that your love may overflow even more, with an increase of knowledge and all discernment.

10.text: This way, you will be able to discern what things are excellent, so that you may be sincere and without offense until the day of Christ,

11.text: filled with the fruits of righteousness which are through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God!

12.text: Now I want you to know, brethren, that what happened to me has turned out to be for the progress of the Good News!

13.text: It became clear to the whole palace guard and to others that my chains are in Christ,

14.text: and most of the brethren in the Lord, being confident through my bonds, are even bolder to speak the word without fear.

15.text: Yes, some actually preach Christ out of envy and rivalry, and some also out of good will.

16.text: The first [group] preaches Christ without sincerity and from selfish ambition, thinking that they are adding affliction to my imprisonment;

17.text: but the second [group] does so out of love, knowing that I have been appointed to defend the Good News.

18.text: Either way, it does not matter. I only care that whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is proclaimed! I rejoice in this, yes, and will continue to rejoice,

19.text: because I know that this will turn out for my salvation, through your supplication and the support of Christâ€™s Spirit.

20.text: It is my eager expectation and hope that I will not be put to shame in any way, but that as I speak with all boldness, Christ will be exalted now as always in my body, whether by my life or by my death.

21.text: For to me, living is Christ and dying is gain.

22.text: But if I remain alive in the flesh, this will bring fruit from my work. Yet, I do not know what I will choose!

23.text: I am in a dilemma between the two, having the desire to be released and be with Christ, which is far better.

24.text: At the same time, to remain in the flesh is a more urgent need for your sake.

25.text: Having this confidence, I know that I will remain and continue with all of you for your progress and joy in faith,

26.text: so that your rejoicing may overflow in Christ Jesus when I am with you again.

27.text: [In the meantime], let your way of life be worthy of the Good News of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or remain absent, I may hear this about your condition: that you stand firm in one spirit, striving with one soul for the faith of the Good News.

28.text: Do not be terrified by your opponents. This will be for them evidence of destruction, but to you, of salvation from God.

29.text: For the sake of Christ, you have been granted the privilege not only to believe in him but also to suffer on his behalf,

30.text: and so you are engaged in the same battle which you saw me fight and that you hear that I am [still] fighting.
